quest.name: Free Trade
journal: Thancred is gazing with interest at the nearby village.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Our only path forward lies ahead─I'm sure of it. So...onward, I suppose!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Sound though Alisaie's logic was, I fear that other perils awaiteth upon this road less traveled.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I take it you're seeing what I'm seeing?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Finding a village when we're hardly ten paces into the hills is a surprising stroke of luck─especially given our recent fortunes─but you won't hear any complaints from me. Let's see if the folk who live here can tell us what to expect from the road ahead.

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: You sell? No... No, you are no merchant. But then, why do I know your face? Hm...

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Oh, I remember! You spent Voeburt gold!

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Such a coinpurse cracking! You are already a legend among Mord traders!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You're a traveling merchant, then. Can you tell us anything of this village?

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Of course, anything for valued customers!

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: This place is Garik. Before the Flood, it was home to many miners. After, not so many. Now, none.

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: So Master Ghen Gen borrowed the village─made it into a trading post. Very convenient location!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: In which case, you all must be familiar with the local roads, correct?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We're on our way to Nabaath Areng, ourselves. If we continue south from here, will we have any difficulties reaching it?

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Oh, yes! Great difficulty...

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: The Flood rent the stone and crushed the mines surrounding Nabaath Areng. Only steep cliffs and collapsed tunnels remain.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, no...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But surely there must be some way. Do you think any of the other Mord might have some sort of hidden route?

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Perhaps. You ask, they tell. Tell for free, even, to friends of our best customer.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Wonderful! Thank you for your help.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well then, “best customer,” let's see what information your reputation buys us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: If we're not lucky enough to encounter anyone who knows a route to Nabaath Areng here, perhaps they can at least point us in the direction of others who might.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I've got it! I'll lead by asking how business is, then mention you, and then ask about the route. That...should work, right?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Perhaps we ought to inquire upon the matter of Eulmoran forces in the region, as well.

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Remember Zhun Zun next time your pockets grow heavy with coin, yes?

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: You wish to go to Nabaath Areng? Hm...

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: There was a way, once. A gondola down from the cliffs. But it was built for those who had left something behind that they wished to retrieve. Now there is nothing left, and no one to use it.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: You may search for it, if you like. But I doubt that its rusted wires would bear your weight.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You hastily take down a memo regarding the gondola on a spare scrap of parchment.

dialogue.name: RHILRIL
dialogue.text: Do try not to end up dangling upside down over a cliff.

dialogue.name: SHULSUL
dialogue.text: Oh, that is a surprise! Not many bound for Nabaath Areng these days.

dialogue.name: SHULSUL
dialogue.text: I do know of a trolley that once went there─it used to travel between all the settlements and mines of the Hills of Amber.

dialogue.name: SHULSUL
dialogue.text: It is locked behind a gate, however. I assume that will have kept it from being stolen or damaged, but it also prevents it from being of much use.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You take down information regarding the trolley on a wrinkled piece of parchment before stuffing it unceremoniously back into your bag.

dialogue.name: SHULSUL
dialogue.text: If you want to use the trolley, you will need to do something about that gate.

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: For Nabaath Areng, airship is best. Nothing is faster than an airship!

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: The Eulmorans have one, I hear. You can ask them to take you!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Though it seems somewhat superfluous to do so, you dutifully make note of Ghon Gon's words.

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: You must find your own airship, if the Eulmorans will not help you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I'm afraid I've learned little of use about how to reach Nabaath Areng. The Eulmoran presence, though─that's another matter.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Apparently, though their army is definitely in Amh Araeng, there have been no sightings of Eulmorans at all in the Hills of Amber. Perhaps we can take that as a sign that Alisaie's plan has borne fruit.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Did you have any better luck finding us a route forward?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: So these are our options... Well, what do you think?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We can try the gondola. Might die, but eh.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Can we get an airship anywhere? Not from Vauthry, obviously.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Gate aside, the trolley seems most feasible.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'd rather not, if it's all the same to you. If it went poorly, we couldn't simply wave our hands and vanish into the aether like Y'shtola─not that I would recommend it, even if we could.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hmm... We could perhaps use amaro, but even from a distance, I can't imagine that the Eulmoran Army wouldn't spot us if we were to travel by air.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It does seem to be the least risky of our options, and I can't imagine one gate is enough to thwart you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'd like to know a bit more before we dash off in search of it, though. Perhaps Zhun Zun can offer some insight.

obj.n: Where There's a Well, There's a Way
